meanings.definition: To show excessive fondness or love for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She was doating on her new puppy, giving it endless cuddles and kisses.
meanings.sent2: The grandmother was doating on her grandchildren, spoiling them with treats and toys.
meanings.sent3: The cat was doating on its reflection in the mirror, thinking it found a new friend.
meanings.sent4: His doating love for her was like a warm blanket on a cold night, comforting and unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The doating mother hen watched over her chicks with a vigilant eye, always ready to protect them.

meanings.definition: To be excessively fond or affectionate.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was doating on her favorite doll, carrying it everywhere she went.
meanings.sent2: He was doating on his vintage car, spending hours polishing it to perfection.
meanings.sent3: The dog was doating on its squeaky toy, refusing to let anyone else play with it.
meanings.sent4: Her doating affection for him was like a beacon of light in his darkest days, guiding him home.
meanings.sent5: The doating fan collected every piece of memorabilia related to her favorite band, creating a shrine of love.

meanings.definition: To be foolishly or excessively fond.
meanings.sent1: She was doating on the idea of becoming a famous singer, despite never having sung before.
meanings.sent2: He was doating on the notion of winning the lottery, spending all his money on tickets.
meanings.sent3: The cat was doating on the laser pointer, chasing the elusive red dot for hours on end.
meanings.sent4: Their doating obsession with social media was like a black hole, sucking up all their time and attention.
meanings.sent5: The doating child believed in the magic of the tooth fairy, leaving extravagant gifts under the pillow every night.
